entry.title: Sweet Like Honey
entry.summary:
Author: ItsBuckleyTime

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,401Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 11

Summary: Eddie is a cynical, sharp-tongued beekeeper who’s perfectly happy living alone with his bees and his books on a quiet mountainside. People annoy him. Especially tourists. Especially loud, cheerful ones who park their camper van too close to his driveway.So when Buck—an endlessly sunny, chatty travel vlogger—rolls into town with a bright yellow van and an even brighter smile, Eddie’ peaceful life is over. Or at least, severely disrupted.

entry.title: i need you
entry.summary:
Author: demigodbeautiies

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,838Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 6

Summary: The silence stretches out between them and taunts Buck with every single thing he thinks he might of said on the phone. He isn't proud of any of it, but what’s done is done. Some things you can't ever get back. Now there’s a distance between them — too big, somehow not that big at all — and Buck knows that he needs Eddie closer.Buck needs him.  Or: Eddie comes back when Buck calls.

entry.title: Ladybug
entry.summary:
Author: bibbawrites

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,559Chapters: 15/18Kudos: 1,125

Summary: Looking up at him, blinking slowly, was a baby. A real life, human baby. Wearing a onesie covered in ladybugs, tucked in with a little pink blanket, squirming, with a letter left in the side of the carrier.“Uh Buck, is that a baby?” Christopher’s voice came from next to him. Buck glanced towards the boy, before looking back down, noticing a small, black bag lent against the side of the carrier.“Seems like it.” He joked lightly, trying to hide the panic he was feeling.“Why is there a baby here?” Chris questioned.“That’s a great question bud.” Buck replied, breathing out slightly. “Why don’t we find out?” aka yet another girl dads buddie fic

entry.title: never thought it would end like this
entry.summary:
Author: Demiwitchwoodwalker

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,665Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 125

Summary: "Buck?""Eds." The pure and utter devastation in Buck’s voice almost had Eddie scrambling to his closet to pull out a bag and start packing immediately. Because Buck– Eddie had never heard Buck sound like that before, besides maybe when he'd found him after the Tsunami all those years ago and– "Eds.""Buck, what's– who–"A sob, choked and absolutely gutted, echoed through the phone and Eddie could already feel tears pricking at the back of his eyes because if Buck was– was–"It's– Bobby's dead. Eddie, he's dead, I–"For a second, the world seemed to stop, screeching to a terrifying, sickening halt, sending him barreling into the abyss of the universe, suffocating without the atmosphere. The words barely registered in his brain, barely scratched the surface of what he could comprehend, because it was Bobby. Bobby Nash. He was– Eddie had always, foolishly, felt like he was immortal.-----Buck calls Eddie and Eddie and Chris decide to come home

entry.title: I see dead people (because I died?)
entry.summary:
Author: Craftysackbot

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,197Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 51

Summary: "Buck, you died""Yeah, and? So did the ghost behind you""What!?""What?" Buck was struck by lightning and was dead for 3 minutes and 17 seconds. Super math skills isn't the only ability that he gained, he can now see and talk to ghosts, but despite others also dying and being brought back to life, they, for some unknown reason, can't see them too, so no one believes him.

entry.title: that something lovers call fate
entry.summary:
Author: theramblingwriter

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 40,177Chapters: 9/17Kudos: 30

Summary: Buck and Eddie first meet in 2016 when Eddie needs a partner to drive with him and his son from El Paso to LA where he's moving to be with his girlfriend and start a new life with the LAFD.He doesn't think he and Buck are destined to be friends. They probably won't think about each other again.Two years later Buck and Eddie run into each other when Eddie is at a cafe with his wife.Buck wonders if this is the universe giving them a second chance to get to know each other. Neither of them take it.Three more years pass by before they meet again.Eddie transfers to the 118 after his divorce, and Buck's still mourning an unexpected breakup with his girlfriend… but this time, things just seem to click.

entry.title: just a little bit of your heart (is all I'm asking for)
entry.summary:
Author: dbolterstar

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 108,139Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 103

Summary: “Does this change a thing between us?” Buck asks, his voice low, his hands still framing Eddie’s face. He can feel the unsteady breaths leaving Eddie’s lips, warm against his own. Eddie looks wrecked. His cheeks are flushed, lips red and kiss-swollen, his glassy eyes locked on Buck’s mouth like it’s the only thing he can see. He looks as hungry as Buck feels. Buck feels Eddie’s fingers trace along his arms, squeezing just enough to leave his skin tingling. “I don’t know.” It’s not a yes—Buck’s not even sure he wants to hear a yes. But it’s so much better than the rejection Eddie threw at him before. “Alright,” Buck exhales, nodding like it’s nothing, even though it feels massive. Then he surges forward, catching Eddie’s mouth in his again. The soft, desperate sound Eddie lets out—like relief and need tangled together—hits Buck like a punch to the chest. or; Eddie’s shame torments him. Buck would rather have a piece of Eddie than nothing at all. Miscommunication is their biggest enemy. Infidelity turns into their savior… or ends up being the thing that destroys them?

entry.title: Flee, Little Soul
entry.summary:
Author: DimsumSsi

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,186Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 92

Summary: “Don’t jump.” The voice cut through the wind, low and steady.Buck didn’t turn around. He didn’t need to. He knew who it was. "Why not?"They’d had this conversation before—on this very rooftop, months ago, when Bobby stepped down and Gerrard briefly took over. When everything felt uncertain, but not final.Back then, Bobby came back. They had a welcome back party together.Except, this time… no matter how hard they prayed, no matter how tightly they held on, Bobby wasn’t walking through those doors again. There would be no return. No miracle. No more Captain Nash of the 118. Not ever.ORBuck was lost—Eddie left, Bobby was gone, and grief sank its teeth in until there’s nothing left to hold on to. Not any more.

entry.title: I'll take it from here
entry.summary:
Author: cathcer1984

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 832Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 155

Summary: Key in hand, Eddie's reaching for the lock when it opens. Dread seeps into his stomach when Eddie sees that it's Tommy on the other side. "Oh," Eddie swallows. "Hi." Tommy's smile is tight and more like a grimace when his eyes drop to the key in Eddie's hand. "Hey," he steps aside with a sweeping arm, gesturing Eddie inside his own fucking house. Stepping past him, Eddie notices that the bedroom door is closed and Buck's brown couch has rumpled blankets on it. Something loosens in Eddie's chest at the knowledge that, even though Tommy is here, he's not in Buck's bed. ---Or the one where Tommy's taken care of Buck until Eddie came home.
